com.smartnsoft.droid4me.widget
Class SmartLinearLayout

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.ViewGroup
          android.widget.LinearLayout
              com.smartnsoft.droid4me.widget.SmartLinearLayout
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
public class SmartLinearLayout
extends android.widget.LinearLayout

Introduced in order to get notified when a container size changes, because there is no OnSizeChangedListener in Android View, whereas there is a View#onSizeChanged() method.

In addition, this class enables to disable the View.requestLayout() method dynamically.

Use this wrapper container every time you need to be notified when a widget sizes changes.

Since:
2012.03.06
Author:
É‰douard Mercier
See Also:
SmartRelativeLayout, SmartFrameLayout

Overrides:
onSizeChanged in class android.view.View

isRequestLayoutDisabled

public boolean isRequestLayoutDisabled()
The default value of the underlying flag is false.

Returns:
true if and only if the requestLayout() method execution should do nothing
See Also:
#setRequestLayoutEnabled(boolean)

setRequestLayoutDisabled

public void setRequestLayoutDisabled(boolean requestLayoutDisabled)
Indicates that the view requestLayout() method execution should do nothing (not invoking the parent method).

This feature is especially useful used in combination with the Gallery widget, which causes flickering issues when updating the widgets inside a ViewGroup.

Parameters:
requestLayoutDisabled - when set to true, the requestLayout() will not invoke its parent method, and hence will do nothing

requestLayout

public void requestLayout()
Specified by:
requestLayout in interface android.view.ViewParent
Overrides:
requestLayout in class android.view.View
